condition.description:
Juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JRA) is a type of arthritis that happens in children age 16 or younger. It causes joint swelling, pain, stiffness, and loss of motion. It can affect any joint, and in some cases it can affect internal organs as well.

One early sign of JRA may be limping in the morning. Symptoms can come and go. Some children have just one or two flare-ups. Others have symptoms that never go away. JRA causes growth problems in some children.

No one knows exactly what causes JRA. Scientists do know it is an autoimmune disorder, which means your immune system, which normally helps your body fight infection, attacks your body's own tissues.

JRA can be hard to diagnose. Your health care provider may do a physical exam, lab tests, and x-rays. Medicines and physical therapy can help maintain movement and reduce swelling and pain.

NIH: National Institute of Arthritis and Musculoskeletal and Skin Diseases
condition.name: Juvenile rheumatoid arthritis

carousel_items: Starts working in 1 to 3 hours.
Take it with a meal or a snack to prevent an upset stomach.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily and it can also cause stomach ulcers.
Don't take it with other blood thinners, like aspirin, unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Can hurt your kidneys, so don't use it if you have a history of kidney problems.

basics.benefits_moa: Celebrex is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Celebrex works well for treating pain and causes less upset stomach than other NSAIDs.
downsides: It's not available as a generic medication, so it's more expensive than many alternatives.
The longer you take Celebrex, the more likely you are to have stomach problems, including inflammation, ulcers, and bleeding. This can also happen if you take Celebrex on an empty stomach.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of blood clots, heart attack, or a stroke.
Can also affect your kidneys or cause permanent kidney damage if taken for a long time.

downsides_processed.orig: It's not available as a generic medication, so it's more expensive than many alternatives.
The longer you take Celebrex, the more likely you are to have stomach problems, including inflammation, ulcers, and bleeding. This can also happen if you take Celebrex on an empty stomach.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of blood clots, heart attack, or a stroke.
Can also affect your kidneys or cause permanent kidney damage if taken for a long time.

upsides: Relieves pain and inflammation for many types of arthritis, including osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, and juvenile rheumatoid arthritis.
Good for treating muscle aches and pains, as well as menstrual cramps.
Causes fewer stomach problems than other NSAIDs like Ibuprofen or Naproxen.
Lasts longer than Ibuprofen.

upsides_processed.orig: Relieves pain and inflammation for many types of arthritis, including osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, and juvenile rheumatoid arthritis.
Good for treating muscle aches and pains, as well as menstrual cramps.
Causes fewer stomach problems than other NSAIDs like Ibuprofen or Naproxen.
Lasts longer than Ibuprofen.

userStories.identifier: I have fibromyalgia and found it helps.
Super active with arthritis in back

userStories.tip: Seemed to work for a couple of weeks.  Then started using it twice a day due to more pain and feeling bad. Finally I realized the temporal headaches, neck stiffness, leg edema and pain were from Celebrex! Took over a week to go away!!!!
I've had good luck with taking it in the AM
if I stop for a few days, I experience pain again and then it takes several days of taking the medication before I am pain free again. It does not provide instant relief

drugs.name: Celebrex

off-label_indications.indication: Colorectal polyp prevention for people with high risk

carousel_items_processed.orig: Starts working in 1 to 3 hours.
Take it with a meal or a snack to prevent an upset stomach.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily and it can also cause stomach ulcers.
Don't take it with other blood thinners, like aspirin, unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Can hurt your kidneys, so don't use it if you have a history of kidney problems.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack and stroke
risks_warnings.description: Taking Celebrex for extended amounts of time can raise your risk of heart attack or stroke, especially if you've had a history of heart disease or are planning heart bypass surgery. Take Celebrex for the shortest amount of time possible needed to control your symptoms to lower this risk. Talk to your doctor about alternatives to Celebrex if you're going to have heart bypass surgery.
risk_factors: History of heart bypass surgery (coronary artery bypass graft/CABG)

description_processed.orig: Taking Celebrex for extended amounts of time can raise your risk of heart attack or stroke, especially if you've had a history of heart disease or are planning heart bypass surgery. Take Celebrex for the shortest amount of time possible needed to control your symptoms to lower this risk. Talk to your doctor about alternatives to Celebrex if you're going to have heart bypass surgery.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Taking Celebrex can raise your risk of ulcers and bleeding in the stomach and intestines, sometimes without warning. Talk to your doctor if you suddenly get sharp pains in your stomach, or you notice bright red blood in your stool or if you notice dark tarry stool.
risk_factors: History of GI bleed or peptic ulcer disease

description_processed.orig: Taking Celebrex can raise your risk of ulcers and bleeding in the stomach and intestines, sometimes without warning. Talk to your doctor if you suddenly get sharp pains in your stomach, or you notice bright red blood in your stool or if you notice dark tarry stool.

risks_warnings.title: Increased blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Celebrex can raise your blood pressure, especially if you've had high blood pressure or you're taking water pills to treat your blood pressure. Check your blood pressure regularly as instructed by your doctor if this becomes a concern.

description_processed.orig: Celebrex can raise your blood pressure, especially if you've had high blood pressure or you're taking water pills to treat your blood pressure. Check your blood pressure regularly as instructed by your doctor if this becomes a concern.

risks_warnings.title: Increased swelling (edema) and fluid retention
risks_warnings.description: Celebrex can cause your arms and legs to swell, or can cause you to retain water, especially if you've been diagnosed with heart failure.

description_processed.orig: Celebrex can cause your arms and legs to swell, or can cause you to retain water, especially if you've been diagnosed with heart failure.

risks_warnings.title: Skin reactions
risks_warnings.description: Some people taking Celebrex have had serious skin reactions, possibly leading to death. However, this has been very rare. Call your doctor or seek emergency help immediately if you develop a sudden high fever with a rash.

description_processed.orig: Some people taking Celebrex have had serious skin reactions, possibly leading to death. However, this has been very rare. Call your doctor or seek emergency help immediately if you develop a sudden high fever with a rash.

risks_warnings.title: Asthma attacks
risks_warnings.description: Some people taking Celebrex have had serious asthma attacks. However, this has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you've had a history of asthma.

description_processed.orig: Some people taking Celebrex have had serious asthma attacks. However, this has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you've had a history of asthma.

risks_warnings.title: Lowered kidney function
risks_warnings.description: Celebrex, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can cause lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage.  You're at higher risk for this if you've a history of kidney disease, heart failure, and liver disease.  Taking Diuretic, ACE inhibitor, or Angiotensin Receptor Blocker (ARB) medications also increases your risk. If you are 65 or older you're also at a higher risk for these types of kidney problems.

description_processed.orig: Celebrex, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can cause lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage.  You're at higher risk for this if you've a history of kidney disease, heart failure, and liver disease.  Taking Diuretic, ACE inhibitor, or Angiotensin Receptor Blocker (ARB) medications also increases your risk. If you are 65 or older you're also at a higher risk for these types of kidney problems.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: If you are in the late stages of pregnancy (more than 30 weeks) taking Celebrex can increase the risk of a heart defect in your baby.  Talk with your doctor before using this medication while pregnant.

description_processed.orig: If you are in the late stages of pregnancy (more than 30 weeks) taking Celebrex can increase the risk of a heart defect in your baby.  Talk with your doctor before using this medication while pregnant.

carousel_items: Take Meloxicam only once a day.  Take it with a meal or a snack to prevent an upset stomach.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily and it can also cause stomach ulcers.
Don't take it with other blood thinners, like aspirin, unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Can hurt your kidneys, so don't use it if you have a history of kidney problems.

clock.tip: Take with food or milk to lower stomach upset.

basics.benefits_moa: Meloxicam is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Meloxicam works well for treating pain and causes less upset stomach than other NSAIDs.
downsides: The longer you take Meloxicam, the more likely you are to have stomach problems, including inflammation, ulcers, and bleeding. This can also happen if you take Meloxicam on an empty stomach.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of blood clots, heart attack, or a stroke.
Can also affect your kidneys or cause permanent kidney damage if taken for a long time.

downsides_processed.orig: The longer you take Meloxicam, the more likely you are to have stomach problems, including inflammation, ulcers, and bleeding. This can also happen if you take Meloxicam on an empty stomach.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of blood clots, heart attack, or a stroke.
Can also affect your kidneys or cause permanent kidney damage if taken for a long time.

upsides: Works well to relieve pain and inflammation from osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, and juvenile rheumatoid arthritis.
Good for muscle aches and pains.
It lasts longer than Ibuprofen, so you can take it less often.
Causes less upset stomach than other NSAIDs, like Ibuprofen.
Can also caus less bruising or bleeding than other NSAIDs when taken at lower doses (7.5 mg per day or less).

didn't do a damn thing to help my muscles relax

It tackles the swelling alone really well, I've been able to move more freely because of it, but since mine is rooted closely with pain as well, I would prefer something that tackles both.

drugs.name: Meloxicam

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take Meloxicam only once a day.  Take it with a meal or a snack to prevent an upset stomach.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily and it can also cause stomach ulcers.
Don't take it with other blood thinners, like aspirin, unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Can hurt your kidneys, so don't use it if you have a history of kidney problems.

risks_warnings.title: Heart Attack or Stroke
risks_warnings.description: Meloxicam can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Taking the lowest dose that works for you, for the shortest time possible, will lower your risk of having this type of problem. Never take Meloxicam during the first two weeks after having heart surgery.

description_processed.orig: Meloxicam can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Taking the lowest dose that works for you, for the shortest time possible, will lower your risk of having this type of problem. Never take Meloxicam during the first two weeks after having heart surgery.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach Bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Meloxicam can cause serious stomach problems that include inflammation, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. These problems can be life threatening and can cause death. The chances that a stomach problem will occur might be worse the longer you take this medication but it can happen at any time.  Watch out for blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.  This can be a medical emergency and you should get help right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers

description_processed.orig: Meloxicam can cause serious stomach problems that include inflammation, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. These problems can be life threatening and can cause death. The chances that a stomach problem will occur might be worse the longer you take this medication but it can happen at any time.  Watch out for blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.  This can be a medical emergency and you should get help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Bruising or Bleeding
risks_warnings.description: You can bruise more easily while using Meloxicam. If you're bleeding, it can take longer than normal for the bleeding to stop. If you're bleeding won't stop it can be life threatening.   This is a medical emergency and you should get help right away. Tell your doctor about all of the medication(s) that you take and all of your medical conditions before starting Meloxicam. Don't take Meloxicam while using other blood thinning medications unless your doctor tells you it is safe.

description_processed.orig: You can bruise more easily while using Meloxicam. If you're bleeding, it can take longer than normal for the bleeding to stop. If you're bleeding won't stop it can be life threatening.   This is a medical emergency and you should get help right away. Tell your doctor about all of the medication(s) that you take and all of your medical conditions before starting Meloxicam. Don't take Meloxicam while using other blood thinning medications unless your doctor tells you it is safe.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Meloxicam can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. Stop taking Meloxicam and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Meloxicam can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. Stop taking Meloxicam and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Lowers Kidney Function
risks_warnings.description: Meloxicam, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage.  Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time necessary can lower your risk for kidney problems.  It is important to get lab tests to check your kidney function periodically if you use Meloxicam for long periods of time.

description_processed.orig: Meloxicam, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage.  Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time necessary can lower your risk for kidney problems.  It is important to get lab tests to check your kidney function periodically if you use Meloxicam for long periods of time.

risks_warnings.title: Increased blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Meloxicam can raise your blood pressure.  Most people usually don't feel any differently when their blood pressure is high so check your blood pressure periodically to watch out for it.    If you have high blood pressure and need a medication for the long-term treatment of pain talk with your doctor. A different medication may be better for you.

description_processed.orig: Meloxicam can raise your blood pressure.  Most people usually don't feel any differently when their blood pressure is high so check your blood pressure periodically to watch out for it.    If you have high blood pressure and need a medication for the long-term treatment of pain talk with your doctor. A different medication may be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: If you are in the late stages of pregnancy (more than 30 weeks) taking Meloxicam can increase the risk of a heart defect in your baby.  Talk with your doctor before using this medication while pregnant.

carousel_items: Don't use if you are allergic to sulfa drugs or aspirin.
Swallow tablets whole, and take after a meal with a full glass of water.
Drink at least six glasses of water daily while on this.
Continue to take Sulfasalazine even once you feel better.
Read the information that come with your medication in the drugstore since there are many conditions you should be aware of before taking Sulfasalazine.
Can cause an orange color in your urine or skin.

basics.benefits_moa: Sulfasalazine is an anti-inflammatory drug that reduces inflammation and pain. It treats inflammatory bowel diseases and rheumatoid arthritis.
basics.bottom_line: Sulfasalazine is used for moderate to severe inflammatory bowel conditions, and with other meds for treating rheumatoid arthritis.
downsides: You need to have blood tests every 3 months when taking Sulfasalazine.
Sulfasalazine isn't a good option if you have kidney or liver disease.
Can't take Sulfasalazine if you are allergic to aspirin or sulfa medications.
Sulfasalazine shouldn't be used if you are breastfeeding.

downsides_processed.orig: You need to have blood tests every 3 months when taking Sulfasalazine.
Sulfasalazine isn't a good option if you have kidney or liver disease.
Can't take Sulfasalazine if you are allergic to aspirin or sulfa medications.
Sulfasalazine shouldn't be used if you are breastfeeding.

upsides: When taken consistently, Sulfasalazine can control your symptoms of ulcerative colitis and other bowel diseases.
Sulfasalazine is usually used in combination with other medications to control rheumatoid arthritis.

upsides_processed.orig: When taken consistently, Sulfasalazine can control your symptoms of ulcerative colitis and other bowel diseases.
Sulfasalazine is usually used in combination with other medications to control rheumatoid arthritis.

userStories.tip: Makes things Orange. I have even been told my skin looks Orange.

It's great medicine. However after 5 years, i was doing really fine. i discontinued sulfasalazine without my doctors consent. After a year or so, the inflammatory symptoms reoccur. Hence don't discontinue it, it's life saving medicine.

drugs.name: Sulfasalazine

off-label_indications.indication: Gastrointestinal tract inflammation caused by radiation

carousel_items_processed.orig: Don't use if you are allergic to sulfa drugs or aspirin.
Swallow tablets whole, and take after a meal with a full glass of water.
Drink at least six glasses of water daily while on this.
Continue to take Sulfasalazine even once you feel better.
Read the information that come with your medication in the drugstore since there are many conditions you should be aware of before taking Sulfasalazine.
Can cause an orange color in your urine or skin.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney damage
risks_warnings.description: Complete blood counts should be done before starting Sulfasalazine and every other week during the first three months of treatment. Since kidney damage can occur, you'll need a urinalysis and an assessment of your kidney function periodically during treatment.

description_processed.orig: Complete blood counts should be done before starting Sulfasalazine and every other week during the first three months of treatment. Since kidney damage can occur, you'll need a urinalysis and an assessment of your kidney function periodically during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Serious skin reactions
risks_warnings.description: Severe and possibly fatal reactions (e.g. Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis) can happen anytime and as early as the first day while taking Sulfasalazine. Tell your doctor or get medical help right away if you notice sores or fluid-filled blisters on your skin, lips, or inside your mouth. You won't be able to re-start Sulfasalazine after this reaction.

description_processed.orig: Severe and possibly fatal reactions (e.g. Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis) can happen anytime and as early as the first day while taking Sulfasalazine. Tell your doctor or get medical help right away if you notice sores or fluid-filled blisters on your skin, lips, or inside your mouth. You won't be able to re-start Sulfasalazine after this reaction.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Severe hypersensitivity reactions can include internal organ involvement, such as hepatitis (liver), nephritis (kidney), myocarditis (heart), blood abnormalities, or pneumonitis (lungs).

description_processed.orig: Severe hypersensitivity reactions can include internal organ involvement, such as hepatitis (liver), nephritis (kidney), myocarditis (heart), blood abnormalities, or pneumonitis (lungs).

risks_warnings.title: Drug interactions
risks_warnings.description: When taking Sulfasalazine with either folic acid and digoxin, it causes both other medications to not be absorbed by your body as well.

description_processed.orig: When taking Sulfasalazine with either folic acid and digoxin, it causes both other medications to not be absorbed by your body as well.

carousel_items: Enbrel is available as a single-use prefilled syringe, single-use prefilled SureClick Autoinjector, and multiple-use vial. You and your doctor can discuss which is best for you.
The autoinjector can be stored at room temperature for up to 14 days and can't be refrigerated again.
Enbrel is a medication that's injected under the skin (subcutaneous). Your doctor can give you your first dose, then let you self-inject it once so you learn how to do it correctly.
Enbrel lowers the your immune system's ability to fight infections, so it's important to let your doctor know if you come down with a fever, cough, or notice flu-like symptoms.
You'll need to have a TB test before you start using Enbrel.
Tell your doctor if you have an allergy to latex since the syringe needle cover has latex in it.
Don't inject Enbrel into skin that's red, bruised, or irritated. Rotate your injection areas to avoid skin reactions.
As with all injection medicines, store away from children and throw used syringes away in a protective container, and not in the trash.

basics.benefits_moa: Enbrel is a biologic response modifier. It works in the immune system to block a protein called TNF (tumor necrosis factor). Blocking TNF relieves symptoms and prevents disease progression.
basics.bottom_line: Enbrel is very effective at calming down your immune system, but it's expensive, you have to take into account the hassle of injections and traveling with the medication.
downsides: It's an injection.
It's expensive because there's no generic available yet.

Enbrel lowers your ability to fight infection and can cause serious life-threatening illness. The risk is greater if you take other drugs that lower your immune system, have an active infection, diabetes, or had tuberculosis (TB) in the past.

You're first dose of Enbrel will need to be given at your doctor's office. If you decide not to self-inject and don't have someone to do it for you, you'll need to continue to see your doctor for each dose.
You'll need to properly dispose of the needle, syringes, or Pen in a special (FDA-approved) sharps container.
Because it needs to be refrigerated until you use it, if you're traveling, you'll need to carry it in a cooler with an ice pack.

downsides_processed.orig: It's an injection.
It's expensive because there's no generic available yet.

Enbrel lowers your ability to fight infection and can cause serious life-threatening illness. The risk is greater if you take other drugs that lower your immune system, have an active infection, diabetes, or had tuberculosis (TB) in the past.

You're first dose of Enbrel will need to be given at your doctor's office. If you decide not to self-inject and don't have someone to do it for you, you'll need to continue to see your doctor for each dose.
You'll need to properly dispose of the needle, syringes, or Pen in a special (FDA-approved) sharps container.
Because it needs to be refrigerated until you use it, if you're traveling, you'll need to carry it in a cooler with an ice pack.

upsides: Treats certain types of arthritis conditions caused by an overactive immune system.
Enbrel is the first biologic approved for moderate to severe rheumatoid arthritis.
It has an established safety profile for treatment of rheumatoid arthritis (RA).
Available as a single-use syringe and SureClick auto-injector pen which may be more convenient and easier for some people to use.
People taking Enbrel for rheumatoid arthritis showed significant improvement and were able to reduce the dose or stop immunosuppressant medicines.

upsides_processed.orig: Treats certain types of arthritis conditions caused by an overactive immune system.
Enbrel is the first biologic approved for moderate to severe rheumatoid arthritis.
It has an established safety profile for treatment of rheumatoid arthritis (RA).
Available as a single-use syringe and SureClick auto-injector pen which may be more convenient and easier for some people to use.
People taking Enbrel for rheumatoid arthritis showed significant improvement and were able to reduce the dose or stop immunosuppressant medicines.

userStories.tip: Travelling with Enbrel is easy. TSA won't bug you at all.

If you sit with an ice pack on your thigh before injections the pain and bruises aren't so bad. Takes about 6 months to work. I went from hobbling in the mornings to a little yoga before a solid 3 miles on the treadmill.
It doesn't take long to get used to giving yourself injections. After the adjustment period, it's wonderful!
When injecting in the thigh, there is a "sweet spot" where it is less painful...I am still trying to get it on that spot each time but I can't seem to get it right.
Make sure to use the Enbrel support system. It gives you free access to Registered Nurses and supplies sharps containers, little cooler, and alcohol wipes.
userStories.identifier: Just a guy with ankylosing spondylitis

userStories.tip: Try it if you have been going through the regimen of stronger and stronger NSAID's and seeing weaker relief. Which is what happened with me.  Biologics are the end of the line. A shot a week. No problems.
it was the only drug that worked- but after a while .....nothing

drugs.name: Enbrel

carousel_items_processed.orig: Enbrel is available as a single-use prefilled syringe, single-use prefilled SureClick Autoinjector, and multiple-use vial. You and your doctor can discuss which is best for you.
The autoinjector can be stored at room temperature for up to 14 days and can't be refrigerated again.
Enbrel is a medication that's injected under the skin (subcutaneous). Your doctor can give you your first dose, then let you self-inject it once so you learn how to do it correctly.
Enbrel lowers the your immune system's ability to fight infections, so it's important to let your doctor know if you come down with a fever, cough, or notice flu-like symptoms.
You'll need to have a TB test before you start using Enbrel.
Tell your doctor if you have an allergy to latex since the syringe needle cover has latex in it.
Don't inject Enbrel into skin that's red, bruised, or irritated. Rotate your injection areas to avoid skin reactions.
As with all injection medicines, store away from children and throw used syringes away in a protective container, and not in the trash.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Enbrel has been reported to cause hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) and angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). If you notice these symptoms after your dose or days later, call your doctor and get medical care right away.

description_processed.orig: Enbrel has been reported to cause hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) and angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). If you notice these symptoms after your dose or days later, call your doctor and get medical care right away.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Enbrel may not be the best choice if you have advanced heart failure with symptoms. If you have mild heart failure and your condition hasn't improved on any other medicine talk to your doctor to see if Enbrel is right for you. You may have to take lower doses and have heart testing before  and during treatment.

description_processed.orig: Enbrel may not be the best choice if you have advanced heart failure with symptoms. If you have mild heart failure and your condition hasn't improved on any other medicine talk to your doctor to see if Enbrel is right for you. You may have to take lower doses and have heart testing before  and during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Serious infections
risks_warnings.description: Enbrel can increase your risk of serious or life-threatening bacterial, fungal and viral infections. In some cases infections can be reactivated from an inactive virus in your body like tuberculosis (TB) or hepatitis B virus (HBV). You may need to take medicine for TB before you can begin taking Enbrel. If you develop symptoms of cough, fever, chills, muscle aches, feel very tired, or you notice dark urine, yellowing of skin/eyes, appetite/weight loss, vomiting, change in stool color, stomach discomfort, and skin rash,  tell your doctor and get medical care right away.

description_processed.orig: Enbrel can increase your risk of serious or life-threatening bacterial, fungal and viral infections. In some cases infections can be reactivated from an inactive virus in your body like tuberculosis (TB) or hepatitis B virus (HBV). You may need to take medicine for TB before you can begin taking Enbrel. If you develop symptoms of cough, fever, chills, muscle aches, feel very tired, or you notice dark urine, yellowing of skin/eyes, appetite/weight loss, vomiting, change in stool color, stomach discomfort, and skin rash,  tell your doctor and get medical care right away.

risks_warnings.title: Malignancy
risks_warnings.description: Based on how Enbrel works, it may lower the body's defenses against malignancies and control how they develop and grow. There appears to be a higher risk of lymphoma, some other cancers, and non-melanoma skin cancer (NMSC) in people who take Enbrel.

description_processed.orig: Based on how Enbrel works, it may lower the body's defenses against malignancies and control how they develop and grow. There appears to be a higher risk of lymphoma, some other cancers, and non-melanoma skin cancer (NMSC) in people who take Enbrel.

risks_warnings.title: Nervous system effects
risks_warnings.description: Although rare, Enbrel can cause nervous system conditions such as multiple sclerosis (MS) and Guillain Barre syndrome. If you currently have a nervous system condition, your doctor will watch you closely while your taking Enbrel since it can make them worse. Let your doctor know right away if you notice numbness or tingling, weakness in arms or legs, vision problems or dizziness.

description_processed.orig: Although rare, Enbrel can cause nervous system conditions such as multiple sclerosis (MS) and Guillain Barre syndrome. If you currently have a nervous system condition, your doctor will watch you closely while your taking Enbrel since it can make them worse. Let your doctor know right away if you notice numbness or tingling, weakness in arms or legs, vision problems or dizziness.

risks_warnings.title: Blood problems
risks_warnings.description: Enbrel can affect blood cells that help you fight infection and stop bleeding. Let your doctor know if you develop a fever that doesn't go away, or you easily bruise, or bleed. You may need to stop taking this medicine.

description_processed.orig: Enbrel can affect blood cells that help you fight infection and stop bleeding. Let your doctor know if you develop a fever that doesn't go away, or you easily bruise, or bleed. You may need to stop taking this medicine.

points.name: Pyrexia
points.dosage: In general, the adverse reactions in pediatric patients were similar in frequency and type as those seen in adult patients

carousel_items: Humira is a medication that's injected under the skin (subcutaneous). Your doctor can give you your first dose, then let you self-inject it once so you learn how to do it correctly.
Humira lowers the your immune system's ability to fight infections, so it's important to let your doctor know if you come down with a fever, cough, or notice flu-like symptoms.
You'll need to have a TB test before you start using Humira.
Tell your doctor if you have an allergy to latex since the syringe needle cover has latex in it.
Don't inject Humira into skin that's red, bruised, or irritated. Rotate your injection areas to avoid skin reactions.
As with all injection medicines, store away from children and throw used syringes away in a protective container, and not in the trash.

basics.benefits_moa: Humira is a biologic response modifier. It works in the immune system to block a protein called TNF (tumor necrosis factor). Blocking TNF relieves symptoms and prevents disease progression.
basics.bottom_line: Humira is very effective at calming down your immune system, but it's expensive, you have to take into account the hassle of injections and traveling with the medication.
downsides: It's an injection.
It's expensive because there's no generic available yet.

Humira lowers your ability to fight infection and can cause serious life-threatening illness. The risk is greater if you take other drugs that lower your immune system, have an active infection, diabetes, or had tuberculosis (TB) in the past.

You're first dose of Humira will need to be given at your doctor's office. If you decide not to self-inject and don't have someone to do it for you, you'll need to continue to see your doctor for each dose.
You'll need to properly dispose of the needle, syringes, or Pen in a special (FDA-approved) sharps container.
Because it needs to be refrigerated until you use it, if you're traveling, you'll need to carry it in a cooler with an ice pack.

downsides_processed.orig: It's an injection.
It's expensive because there's no generic available yet.

Humira lowers your ability to fight infection and can cause serious life-threatening illness. The risk is greater if you take other drugs that lower your immune system, have an active infection, diabetes, or had tuberculosis (TB) in the past.

You're first dose of Humira will need to be given at your doctor's office. If you decide not to self-inject and don't have someone to do it for you, you'll need to continue to see your doctor for each dose.
You'll need to properly dispose of the needle, syringes, or Pen in a special (FDA-approved) sharps container.
Because it needs to be refrigerated until you use it, if you're traveling, you'll need to carry it in a cooler with an ice pack.

upsides: Treats certain types of arthritis and gastrointestinal conditions caused by an overactive immune system.
Most people feel it's worth the hassle.
Once you've learned the correct way to use Humira, you can inject the medicine yourself without going to your doctor's office.
It's available in a single-use pen (Humira Pen) that may be more convenient and easier for some people to use.
It's an alternative for people with Crohn's disease who stopped getting better on other TNF-blockers or had side effects that made them switch.

upsides_processed.orig: Treats certain types of arthritis and gastrointestinal conditions caused by an overactive immune system.
Most people feel it's worth the hassle.
Once you've learned the correct way to use Humira, you can inject the medicine yourself without going to your doctor's office.
It's available in a single-use pen (Humira Pen) that may be more convenient and easier for some people to use.
It's an alternative for people with Crohn's disease who stopped getting better on other TNF-blockers or had side effects that made them switch.

userStories.tip: Works great. No more flares
Keep to your dosing schedule - keep dates when they're due on your calendar or diary.  Try to do it at a weekend when you aren't rushing or likely to forget!
When you take the Humira out of the fridge, hold it under your arm for 10 minutes or so to let it war to room temperature-it stings a lot less.
take the injection out of the fridge and let it come to room temp before injecting!
No more loose bowl movements, signs of blood, or lack of energy. Humira works great with my other medications to control UC.

Travelling can be huge pain with this refridgeerator medication. There are 30 hour chill containers out there. One piece of advice that really help me is if you can find ice. Do to the nearest fast food place and bring a ziploc bag
Makes my life so much better because I don't have flair ups. I don't have side effects or get sick easily either.
I find the prefilled syringes to be significantly less painful than the pen. Also, I only inject my thighs.

drugs.name: Humira

carousel_items_processed.orig: Humira is a medication that's injected under the skin (subcutaneous). Your doctor can give you your first dose, then let you self-inject it once so you learn how to do it correctly.
Humira lowers the your immune system's ability to fight infections, so it's important to let your doctor know if you come down with a fever, cough, or notice flu-like symptoms.
You'll need to have a TB test before you start using Humira.
Tell your doctor if you have an allergy to latex since the syringe needle cover has latex in it.
Don't inject Humira into skin that's red, bruised, or irritated. Rotate your injection areas to avoid skin reactions.
As with all injection medicines, store away from children and throw used syringes away in a protective container, and not in the trash.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Humira has been reported to cause hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) and angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). If you notice these symptoms after your dose or days later, call your doctor and get medical care right away.

description_processed.orig: Humira has been reported to cause hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) and angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). If you notice these symptoms after your dose or days later, call your doctor and get medical care right away.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Humira may not be the best choice if you have advanced heart failure with symptoms. If you have mild heart failure and your condition hasn't improved on any other medicine talk to your doctor to see if Humira is right for you. You may have to take lower doses and have heart testing before  and during treatment.

carousel_items: Don't use alcohol, NSAIDs (anti-inflammatory medications), or stay in the sun too long.
Use birth control and avoid pregnancy for at least 2 months (for women) and 3 months (for men) after you finish Methotrexate.
Drink plenty of liquids to stay hydrated while taking this.
Take the medication exactly as your doctor or pharmacist tells you. Call your doctor or pharmacist if you're confused.

basics.benefits_moa: Methotrexate is an anti-cancer and immunosuppressive medication that treats forms of cancer, arthritis, and psoriasis. For cancer, it helps your body destroy cancer cells by blocking building blocks that cancer cells need to grow. For rheumatoid arthritis and psoriasis, it lowers the body's normal immune response and prevents the body from attacking itself.
basics.bottom_line: Methotrexate is a first line treatment for many autoimmune diseases and types of cancer. If you're taking it for a long time, you'll have to get routine blood tests.
downsides: You have to be on birth control for at least 2 to 3 months after you finish Methotrexate since it can cause birth defects.
You have to avoid alcohol and being in the sun too long.
You'll have to get blood tests done if you're taking this long-term because it can cause harmful side effects.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to be on birth control for at least 2 to 3 months after you finish Methotrexate since it can cause birth defects.
You have to avoid alcohol and being in the sun too long.
You'll have to get blood tests done if you're taking this long-term because it can cause harmful side effects.

upsides: Recommended as first line treatment for rheumatoid arthritis.
Available as a generic medication. Comes as a tablet, an injection that you give yourself weekly, and as an infusion that you get in your doctor's office or at an infusion center.
If you accidentally take too much, there's an antidote to help your body recover.

upsides_processed.orig: Recommended as first line treatment for rheumatoid arthritis.
Available as a generic medication. Comes as a tablet, an injection that you give yourself weekly, and as an infusion that you get in your doctor's office or at an infusion center.
If you accidentally take too much, there's an antidote to help your body recover.

drugs.one_liner: Treats cancer and changes how your immune system works.

userStories.tip: Severe nausea. My physician prescribed it on saturday night and sunday twice. Modify to take on alternative days
i take the injectable, hassle. and experience side effects. take folic acid
It took 4-5 months for side effects to become tolerable, but eventually they did.

drugs.name: Methotrexate

carousel_items_processed.orig: Don't use alcohol, NSAIDs (anti-inflammatory medications), or stay in the sun too long.
Use birth control and avoid pregnancy for at least 2 months (for women) and 3 months (for men) after you finish Methotrexate.
Drink plenty of liquids to stay hydrated while taking this.
Take the medication exactly as your doctor or pharmacist tells you. Call your doctor or pharmacist if you're confused.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Talk to your doctor if you are planning to have a baby or are pregnant. Methotrexate can cause birth defects, including death. You or your partner will need to be on birth control for at least 2 to 3 months after you finish Methotrexate to lower this risk.

description_processed.orig: Talk to your doctor if you are planning to have a baby or are pregnant. Methotrexate can cause birth defects, including death. You or your partner will need to be on birth control for at least 2 to 3 months after you finish Methotrexate to lower this risk.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: If you're taking Methotrexate, you’ll need to have your blood checked to avoid toxic effects (blood cells, platelets, liver enzymes, kidney function) and chest X-rays when you start and every 1 to 2 months during treatment. Methotrexate can also cause malignant lymphoma (cancer of the white blood cells). It can happen when you take low-doses of Methotrexate.

description_processed.orig: If you're taking Methotrexate, you’ll need to have your blood checked to avoid toxic effects (blood cells, platelets, liver enzymes, kidney function) and chest X-rays when you start and every 1 to 2 months during treatment. Methotrexate can also cause malignant lymphoma (cancer of the white blood cells). It can happen when you take low-doses of Methotrexate.

risks_warnings.title: Toxicity
risks_warnings.description: You are at higher risk of having toxic symptoms because of too much Methotrexate in your blood if you have kidney disease, or if you have fluid in the abdomen (ascites) or in the lungs (pleural effusion). Your doctor will monitor your body's reaction to Methotrexate very closely if they decide you need to be on Methotrexate.

description_processed.orig: You are at higher risk of having toxic symptoms because of too much Methotrexate in your blood if you have kidney disease, or if you have fluid in the abdomen (ascites) or in the lungs (pleural effusion). Your doctor will monitor your body's reaction to Methotrexate very closely if they decide you need to be on Methotrexate.

risks_warnings.title: Liver disease
risks_warnings.description: If you're on Methotrexate for psoriasis, your doctor will have you to do lab tests to check your liver on a regular basis. Acute sudden changes to the liver have been reported, but this has been rare. Call your doctor if you suddenly have pain in your abdomen, you don't feel like eating, or if your skin or the whites of your eyes become yellow.

description_processed.orig: If you're on Methotrexate for psoriasis, your doctor will have you to do lab tests to check your liver on a regular basis. Acute sudden changes to the liver have been reported, but this has been rare. Call your doctor if you suddenly have pain in your abdomen, you don't feel like eating, or if your skin or the whites of your eyes become yellow.

risks_warnings.title: Lung disease
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people on Methotrexate who develop lung disease. This is very rare. Call your doctor immediately if you suddenly get a dry non-productive cough and you don't have a cold or flu.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people on Methotrexate who develop lung disease. This is very rare. Call your doctor immediately if you suddenly get a dry non-productive cough and you don't have a cold or flu.

risks_warnings.title: Diarrhea | Sores in the mouth
risks_warnings.description: Call your doctor immediately if you suddenly get diarrhea or if you get sores in your mouth. This could be a sign of too much Methotrexate in your blood, and your doctor may stop the medication or prescribe an antidote.

description_processed.orig: Call your doctor immediately if you suddenly get diarrhea or if you get sores in your mouth. This could be a sign of too much Methotrexate in your blood, and your doctor may stop the medication or prescribe an antidote.

risks_warnings.title: Skin reactions
risks_warnings.description: People have reported severe skin reactions while on Methotrexate which can require hospitalization, or possibly cause death. Call your doctor immediately if you get a high fever and a sudden blistering skin rash.

description_processed.orig: People have reported severe skin reactions while on Methotrexate which can require hospitalization, or possibly cause death. Call your doctor immediately if you get a high fever and a sudden blistering skin rash.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney injury
risks_warnings.description: Tumor lysis syndrome happens when cancer cells are broken down very quickly and damage the kidneys. The damage can be so bad that people need dialysis. If you're taking Methotrexate to treat cancer, your doctor can give you medicines and take measures to prevent this reaction.

description_processed.orig: Tumor lysis syndrome happens when cancer cells are broken down very quickly and damage the kidneys. The damage can be so bad that people need dialysis. If you're taking Methotrexate to treat cancer, your doctor can give you medicines and take measures to prevent this reaction.

carousel_items: Keep the Orencia self-injection refrigerated, but let it rest at room temperature for 30 to 60 minutes before using it.
Each time you use Orencia, be sure to rotate the sites you chose to inject it in. Don't inject it where your skin is tender, bruised, red, or scaly.
If you decide to go with the IV version of Orencia, you will only need to get infusions once a month. The self-injections however need to be taken once a week.
If you get the IV infusion, stay hydrated, try to relax, and ask your nurse to apply dry heat (instant warm packs) to your arm to help find your good veins.

basics.benefits_moa: Orencia is called a DMARD, a disease-modifying antirheumatic drug. It prevents your body from activating cells that cause inflammation.
basics.bottom_line: Orencia slows the progress of rheumatoid arthritis, but can also have serious side effects.
downsides: You'll have to get your blood tested regularly while taking Orencia.
You'll probably have to take other medications to help treat your RA symptoms.
Orencia is pretty expensive.
The IV infusion form of Orencia can cause a reaction, which ranges from a slight itching or warm feeling to more serious complications like low blood pressure and chest pain.
Because RA is chronic disease, you'll likely take Orencia for many years.

downsides_processed.orig: You'll have to get your blood tested regularly while taking Orencia.
You'll probably have to take other medications to help treat your RA symptoms.
Orencia is pretty expensive.
The IV infusion form of Orencia can cause a reaction, which ranges from a slight itching or warm feeling to more serious complications like low blood pressure and chest pain.
Because RA is chronic disease, you'll likely take Orencia for many years.

upsides: Helps minimize joint damage, lowers symptoms, and prevents future problems.
In a 2-year study that used IV Orencia with methotrexate, more than half of the people had remission and the majority felt significantly better.
People taking [name-common] had no new joint damage after two years.
Taking Orencia allows RA patients to use less prednisone, a steroid that has many side effects.
Orencia can be used without other medications for RA.

upsides_processed.orig: Helps minimize joint damage, lowers symptoms, and prevents future problems.
In a 2-year study that used IV Orencia with methotrexate, more than half of the people had remission and the majority felt significantly better.
People taking [name-common] had no new joint damage after two years.
Taking Orencia allows RA patients to use less prednisone, a steroid that has many side effects.
Orencia can be used without other medications for RA.

drugs.one_liner: Orencia decreases inflammation in rheumatoid arthritis.

userStories.tip: That I didn't have to take so many pills that made me nauseated.
keep with it. It doesnt work immediately but it improved my symptons by 80%
weekly self injections are  much easier than infusion and work fine. Target (t-cells) is different from many other RA medicines and may work well where others fail

drugs.name: Orencia

carousel_items_processed.orig: Keep the Orencia self-injection refrigerated, but let it rest at room temperature for 30 to 60 minutes before using it.
Each time you use Orencia, be sure to rotate the sites you chose to inject it in. Don't inject it where your skin is tender, bruised, red, or scaly.
If you decide to go with the IV version of Orencia, you will only need to get infusions once a month. The self-injections however need to be taken once a week.
If you get the IV infusion, stay hydrated, try to relax, and ask your nurse to apply dry heat (instant warm packs) to your arm to help find your good veins.

risks_warnings.title: Use with TNF antagonists
risks_warnings.description: You shouldn't take Orencia with TNF antagonists (other DMARDs like Remicade, Humira, and Enbrel). People taking any of these combinations can experience more infections.

description_processed.orig: You shouldn't take Orencia with TNF antagonists (other DMARDs like Remicade, Humira, and Enbrel). People taking any of these combinations can experience more infections.

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Orencia can cause hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) and angioedema (swelling of the tongue). This is a medical emergency and you should get medical attention immediately.

description_processed.orig: Orencia can cause hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) and angioedema (swelling of the tongue). This is a medical emergency and you should get medical attention immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Live vaccines
risks_warnings.description: You should not be immunized with live vaccines within 3 months of taking Orencia. Children who have RA should catch up on all of their immunizations before starting Orencia.

description_processed.orig: You should not be immunized with live vaccines within 3 months of taking Orencia. Children who have RA should catch up on all of their immunizations before starting Orencia.

risks_warnings.title: Immunosuppression
risks_warnings.description: Orencia can interfere with your immune response and function, meaning that your body can be susceptible to more viruses and infections.
risk_factors: Adults with rheumatoid arthritis taking TNF inhibitors

description_processed.orig: Orencia can interfere with your immune response and function, meaning that your body can be susceptible to more viruses and infections.

points.name: Back pain
points.hlt: musculoskeletal and connective tissue pain and discomfort

points.name: Pain in extremity
points.hlt: musculoskeletal and connective tissue pain and discomfort

carousel_items: Remicade is a medication that's given as an infusion at your doctor's office or clinic.
It's very important to read the patient Medication Guide when you first start using Remicade.
It's possible to get an allergic reaction to Remicade either immediately during the treatment or a several days after stopping it. Your doctor can give you medicines that'll lower this risk.
You'll need to have a TB test before you start taking Remicade and periodically during treatment.

Remicade lowers your immune system's ability to fight infections, so it's important to let your doctor know if you notice a fever, cough, or flu-like symptoms. Children seem to get more infections than adults, so keep a close eye on them.

If you have a young child, let their doctor know if you were on Remicade while pregnant or nursing. It can increase their risk of infections for several months after your last dose and can delay their vaccine schedule.

basics.benefits_moa: Remicade is a biologic response modifier. It works in the immune system to block a protein called TNF (tumor necrosis factor). Blocking TNF relieves symptoms and prevents disease progression.
basics.bottom_line: Remicade is very effective at calming down your immune system, but you have to get each dose at your doctor's office and watch out for serious side effects.
downsides: You have to get every dose through an IV infusion at your doctor's office.
It's expensive because there's no generic available yet.

Remicade has a higher risk of serious infusion-related side effects during or after it's given since it's injected right into your veins. Your doctor can prescribe medication before your dose that may lower this risk.

Remicade lowers your ability to fight infection and can cause serious life-threatening illness. The risk is greater if you take other drugs that lower your immune system, have an active infection, diabetes, or had tuberculosis (TB) in the past.
Not the best choice if you have heart failure.

Talk to your baby's doctor if you're pregnant or breast-feeding. When women in a study took Remicade, the medicine was found in their breast milk 2 to 3 days after each dose, and in the baby's blood 6 months after they were born.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to get every dose through an IV infusion at your doctor's office.
It's expensive because there's no generic available yet.

Remicade has a higher risk of serious infusion-related side effects during or after it's given since it's injected right into your veins. Your doctor can prescribe medication before your dose that may lower this risk.

Remicade lowers your ability to fight infection and can cause serious life-threatening illness. The risk is greater if you take other drugs that lower your immune system, have an active infection, diabetes, or had tuberculosis (TB) in the past.
Not the best choice if you have heart failure.

Talk to your baby's doctor if you're pregnant or breast-feeding. When women in a study took Remicade, the medicine was found in their breast milk 2 to 3 days after each dose, and in the baby's blood 6 months after they were born.

upsides: Treats certain types of arthritis and gastrointestinal conditions caused by an overactive immune system.
Remicade has almost two decades of clinical trial data and real-life experience with millions of people who have used it.
Initial dosing to introduce Remicade to your body might be a hassle, but then you only need to take it every 6-8 weeks depending on your condition.

upsides_processed.orig: Treats certain types of arthritis and gastrointestinal conditions caused by an overactive immune system.
Remicade has almost two decades of clinical trial data and real-life experience with millions of people who have used it.
Initial dosing to introduce Remicade to your body might be a hassle, but then you only need to take it every 6-8 weeks depending on your condition.

userStories.tip: Remicade changed my life. Before I started it, I was in constant pain and had a difficult time getting out of a chair or turning over in bed. Now I have only minor pain and live a full and happy life.
Have gotten severe psoriasis from the medication.
Make sure to get lots of rest for the rest of the day. Don't go on a plane within a day or two or you will get sick.
userStories.identifier: early 30s single with 70 hour work week

userStories.tip: I have been in remission since my first dose!

drugs.name: Remicade

carousel_items_processed.orig: Remicade is a medication that's given as an infusion at your doctor's office or clinic.
It's very important to read the patient Medication Guide when you first start using Remicade.
It's possible to get an allergic reaction to Remicade either immediately during the treatment or a several days after stopping it. Your doctor can give you medicines that'll lower this risk.
You'll need to have a TB test before you start taking Remicade and periodically during treatment.

Remicade lowers your immune system's ability to fight infections, so it's important to let your doctor know if you notice a fever, cough, or flu-like symptoms. Children seem to get more infections than adults, so keep a close eye on them.

If you have a young child, let their doctor know if you were on Remicade while pregnant or nursing. It can increase their risk of infections for several months after your last dose and can delay their vaccine schedule.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Remicade has been reported to cause hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) and angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). If you notice these symptoms after your dose or days later, call your doctor and get medical care right away.

description_processed.orig: Remicade has been reported to cause hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) and angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). If you notice these symptoms after your dose or days later, call your doctor and get medical care right away.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Remicade may not be the best choice if you have advanced heart failure with symptoms. If you have mild heart failure and your condition hasn't improved on any other medicine talk to your doctor to see if Remicade is right for you. You may have to take lower doses and have heart testing before  and during treatment.

description_processed.orig: Remicade may not be the best choice if you have advanced heart failure with symptoms. If you have mild heart failure and your condition hasn't improved on any other medicine talk to your doctor to see if Remicade is right for you. You may have to take lower doses and have heart testing before  and during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Serious infections
risks_warnings.description: Remicade can increase your risk of serious or life-threatening bacterial, fungal and viral infections. In some cases infections can be reactivated from an inactive virus in your body like tuberculosis (TB) or hepatitis B virus (HBV). You may need to take medicine for TB before you can begin taking Remicade. If you develop symptoms of cough, fever, chills, muscle aches, feel very tired, or you notice dark urine, yellowing of skin/eyes, appetite/weight loss, vomiting, change in stool color, stomach discomfort, and skin rash,  tell your doctor and get medical care right away.

description_processed.orig: Remicade can increase your risk of serious or life-threatening bacterial, fungal and viral infections. In some cases infections can be reactivated from an inactive virus in your body like tuberculosis (TB) or hepatitis B virus (HBV). You may need to take medicine for TB before you can begin taking Remicade. If you develop symptoms of cough, fever, chills, muscle aches, feel very tired, or you notice dark urine, yellowing of skin/eyes, appetite/weight loss, vomiting, change in stool color, stomach discomfort, and skin rash,  tell your doctor and get medical care right away.

risks_warnings.title: Malignancy
risks_warnings.description: Based on how Remicade works, it may lower the body's defenses against malignancies and control how they develop and grow. There appears to be a higher risk of lymphoma, some other cancers, and non-melanoma skin cancer (NMSC) in people who take Remicade.

description_processed.orig: Based on how Remicade works, it may lower the body's defenses against malignancies and control how they develop and grow. There appears to be a higher risk of lymphoma, some other cancers, and non-melanoma skin cancer (NMSC) in people who take Remicade.

risks_warnings.title: Nervous system effects
risks_warnings.description: Although rare, Remicade can cause nervous system conditions such as multiple sclerosis (MS) and Guillain Barre syndrome. If you currently have a nervous system condition, your doctor will watch you closely while you're taking Remicade since it can make them worse. Let your doctor know right away if you notice numbness or tingling, weakness in arms or legs, vision problems or dizziness.

description_processed.orig: Although rare, Remicade can cause nervous system conditions such as multiple sclerosis (MS) and Guillain Barre syndrome. If you currently have a nervous system condition, your doctor will watch you closely while you're taking Remicade since it can make them worse. Let your doctor know right away if you notice numbness or tingling, weakness in arms or legs, vision problems or dizziness.

risks_warnings.title: Blood problems
risks_warnings.description: Remicade can affect blood cells that help you fight infection and stop bleeding. Let your doctor know if you develop a fever that doesn't go away, or you easily bruise, or bleed. You may need to stop taking this medicine.

description_processed.orig: Remicade can affect blood cells that help you fight infection and stop bleeding. Let your doctor know if you develop a fever that doesn't go away, or you easily bruise, or bleed. You may need to stop taking this medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Liver injury
risks_warnings.description: Although rare, Remicade can cause serious liver injury. You'll need to have your liver enzymes tested regularly. If liver enzymes are significantly elevated and you have appetite/weight loss, stomach discomfort, vomiting, and notice dark urine, yellowing of skin/eyes, change in stool color, and skin rash you should stop treatment with Remicade until you can be completely assessed,
